Name: yarn production, silk, long fibre | yarn, silk | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1311:Preparation and spinning of textile fibres
Description: Each cocoon is made up of a filament between 600 and 900 meters long. Nine cocoons are reeled togetehr to form a 20 denier filament at the reeling stage. Four of these super-fine filaments are doubled together to make one yarn on doubling machine and wound on to spools. This filament is then twisted in next operation and then wound into skeins.  ;since this dataset reflects a handloom process, there are no machinery modelled
